story.iWant: to initialize the Next.js + Supabase project and deploy it to Vercel
story.soThat: we have a live URL and a production-ready environment from day one
story.tasks: - [ ] **Project Initialization** (AC: 1, 2, 3, 6) - [ ] Execute `npx create-next-app -e with-supabase digital-guess-who`. - [ ] Configure the Supabase project (create new project on Supabase, get API keys). - [ ] Push the initialized project to GitHub. - [ ] **Vercel Deployment Setup** (AC: 4, 5) - [ ] Connect the GitHub repository to a new Vercel project. - [ ] Configure Vercel environment variables (`NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL`, `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY`) with values from Supabase. - [ ] Verify successful build and deployment to a production URL. - [ ] **Verification** - [ ] **(AC: 3)** Verify a new Next.js 15+ (App Router) project with TypeScript is created locally. - [ ] **(AC: 4)** Verify in Vercel dashboard that the project is connected to the GitHub repository. - [ ] **(AC: 5)** Access the deployed production URL and verify the landing page loads without errors. - [ ] **(AC: 6)** Verify the repository is pushed to GitHub with the initial project scaffolding.

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. **Given** I have the necessary Vercel and Supabase credentials 2. **When** I run the initialization command `npx create-next-app -e with-supabase` 3. **Then** A new Next.js 15+ (App Router) project is created with TypeScript 4. **And** The project is connected to a Vercel project 5. **And** A successful build is deployed to a production URL (e.g., `digital-guess-who.vercel.app`) 6. **And** The repository is pushed to GitHub

doc.title: Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: The project's core magic lies in this shared social experience. As a school project, the focus is on delivering a high-quality, stable, and intuitive web application that demonstrates professional development practices.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: The project will be initialized using the official Vercel Next.js + Supabase starter template. Execute: `npx create-next-app -e with-supabase digital-guess-who`.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: Frontend Framework: Next.js 15+ (App Router). Database: PostgreSQL (via Supabase). Authentication: Supabase Auth. Styling: Tailwind CSS 4.x.

doc.title: Epic Technical Specification
doc.snippet: Epic 1 primarily focuses on establishing the foundational services: Next.js Application Core, Supabase Integration, Database Schema, UI Library (shadcn/ui), Global Styles.

doc.title: Epic Technical Specification
doc.snippet: 1. Project Scaffolding: Initialize Next.js project using `create-next-app` with Supabase integration. Configure basic repository and Vercel deployment.

doc.title: UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Chosen Design System: shadcn/ui. Rationale: Unstyled, customizable components built on Radix UI and integrated with Tailwind.

constraints.item: Must use `npx create-next-app -e with-supabase` for initialization
Must use TypeScript in Strict mode
API keys must be managed via `.env.local` and never committed
Deployment must be automated via Vercel on push to main

tests.standards: Verify successful project deployment to Vercel. Confirm basic navigation to landing page. Visual inspection of global styles. Verify generated types match schema.

ideas.idea: Verify `.env.local` exists (locally) and has Supabase keys
Check HTTP 200 OK on Vercel deployment URL
